intro: Ipomoea graniticola, commonly known as the granite morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found growing in rocky or calcareous soils. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and climbers. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
